hints.content: To divide a shape in fourths, we divide the whole into **$4$ equal parts**.

These rectangles are not divided into $4$ pieces:  

![A rectangle has 2 vertical lines and 1 horizontal line dividing it into 6 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b0aad1a1804374804e5560c9d3bda809dbadc0a4)
![A rectangle has 1 horizontal line dividing it into 2 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6a8780751b3c6460666c1693afbd7c0e9e559fc2)

These rectangles are divided into fourths:  

![A rectangle has 1 vertical line and 1 horizontal line dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2c7ce490f59aca1ff4cd299d97e9abb6f27cc80a)

![A rectangle has 3 horizontal lines dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/de9ffb96b7b818d7283514d4d167e915f7c9dae3)

question.content:
**Which rectangles are divided into fourths?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A rectangle has 2 vertical lines and 1 horizontal line dividing it into 6 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b0aad1a1804374804e5560c9d3bda809dbadc0a4)
![A rectangle has 1 horizontal line dividing it into 2 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6a8780751b3c6460666c1693afbd7c0e9e559fc2)
![A rectangle has 1 vertical line and 1 horizontal line dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2c7ce490f59aca1ff4cd299d97e9abb6f27cc80a)
![A rectangle has 3 horizontal lines dividing it into 4 equal parts.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/de9ffb96b7b818d7283514d4d167e915f7c9dae3)
